newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Duma to mull oil production sharing in April.
newsitem.headline: Russian Duma to mull oil production sharing in April.

text.p: Russia's Natural Resources Minister said on Tuesday the State Duma lower house of parliament would probably consider a new draft list of oil and other reserves open for production-sharing agreements in two to three weeks.
"I think a motion will be introduced on to the Duma floor most likely somewhere in the second half of April, around April 15-20," Viktor Orlov told a news conference.
He said a Duma working committee would meet this Thursday to agree the criteria for including reserves on the list and then take about a week to compile the list itself.

Communist and nationalist opposition parties in the Duma have delayed approving the list, which is crucial to the implementation of an existing law on production-sharing, along with several other amendments.
Last month the Duma blocked a scheduled vote on the list, which Orlov said now comprises 49 reserves out of an original 127 chosen by the government last year.
The Duma is expected to halve that number, fuelling fears among potential foreign investors that reserves not on the list will require separate approval from parliament.
But Orlov said that reserves which are not included in the final list might be eligible for inclusion on a rolling basis in subsequent lists.
"The government has proposed a list of 49 possible agreements, but at the same time it confirms all 127, calling them 'prospects' for inclusion in future lists," Orlov said.
Foreign investors will not have the right to sign production-sharing agreements involving reserves which have not been included on the list, he added.
